page.title: 11LANDSCAPE
page.content: The main geology of the Havant area is based on chalk.To the west is a large area of marshy land called{Farlington {Marshes}and rising to the north are the{South Downs.}The landscape of chalk allows water to seep through the ground,and come up again as springs. The maximum height this area has is the start of{Portsdown Hill-90m/300ft. {Portsdown Hill}is a long chalk ridge, overlooking Portsmouth.There is little remaining woodland in this area.The Havant Gap is slowly diminishing because of the need for housing,and the A3M runs through it.The sea bed is composed of sand,mud,and shingle, with narrow channels at low tide. Large areas of marshland have been reclaimed from the north of Langstone Harbour,this has been combined with waste disposal and sewage works.
